node.title: Malta becomes first European nation to approve cannabis for personal use
node.description: Malta becomes the first European country to allow limited cultivation and possession of cannabis for personal use, following a vote in parliament.
node.content:
["Malta has decriminalised the possession and cultivation of cannabis for personal use by adults\u00a0and taken\u00a0steps to set up what could become Europe's first cannabis regulatory authority.", "Under the new legislative package, it will become legal for anyone 18 and over to possess up to 7 grams of cannabis and to cultivate up to four plants.", "Growers for personal use can store up to 50 grams of dried marijuana.", "However, consuming cannabis in public or in the presence of minors remains illegal and subject to fines of up to 500 euros ($793).", "The move by Malta is likely to be followed by reform across Europe next year.", "Luxembourg announced similar plans in October but its parliament has yet to give its green light to the measure.", "The new regulations will allow for the setting up of non-profit clubs that can distribute cannabis and cannabis plant seeds among their members.", "And it calls for the establishment of an authority that will work with the government on national policy governing cannabis use.", "The law, which was approved in parliament by 36 votes to 27,\u00a0faced\u00a0fierce criticism from the centre-right opposition, medical associations and the church who complained that their requests to water down the proposals were ignored.", "", "
Consuming cannabis in public or in the presence of minors remains illegal.(Reuters:\u00a0Toussaint Kluiters)
", "The opposition Nationalist Party argued\u00a0that the bill would normalise and increase drug abuse in Malta.", "The minister who sponsored the legislation, Owen Bonnici, said the package aimed to \"stop treating people who are not criminals like criminals\", create a regulatory system and \"protect minors and society at large\".", "\"The government always urges people to make healthier choices.\"", "The regulations\u00a0must be signed into law by the president, which is usually a formality.", "Malta is also seeking to position itself as a European leader in the production of medical cannabis having approved legislation in 2018 to permit the production of such cannabis for medicinal and research purposes.", "ABC/wires"]
